channel.description:
Hi,
The game runs pretty smooth on high graphics, but whenever i get near to water it causes major lag. I allready have the watertextures set on lowest as possible but it does not work.
Wich other settings could help me?

item.title: Water causes major lag.
item.dc:creator: amd2800barton
item.description:
It might help to link to and/or list the config settings rather than vaguely referencing a sticky. For anyone else running in to this, setting r_WaterDrawReflection to 0 is what did it for me.

Side note - of course I’m running boot camp. I highly doubt that I could run even a GoldSource game in Wine or a Virtual Machine… playably at least.

item.title: Water causes major lag.
item.dc:creator: lexa2
item.description:
amd2800barton:

…
Playing on a 2011 Macbook Air - I know, I know, but it runs my other source games surprisingly well.

Core i5 1.7Ghz (Sandy Bridge)
4GB ram
Intel HD3000 graphics
SSD

Anyone got a solution to this, aside from buy a better computer?

Read a FAQ sticky thread, there’s a set of config settings that could help you to temporarily turn off water reflections which are the problem cause for your case most likely. Also, if you’re playing on OS X using Wine or CrossOver - consider buying/installing BootCamp + Windows, you have a really bad GPU to play this game on its own and using D3D->OGL emulation provided by Wine doesn’t help either.

As for OP, I have to write it once again as I had been doing it 100500 times in other threads: please please PLEASE DO READ BEFORE YOU POST sticky and DO READ FAQ sticky before reporting the problem and please please please DO FOLLOW REPORTING GUIDELINES. Include hardware and software specs of your PC in the reports. For FPS dropdowns - include screenshots of the problematic spot (or spots) with the budget panel turned on.

We’re not magicians here on forums and can’t provide any help unless we know as much details about the problem as possible.
